src.schemas package

Submodules

src.schemas.contacts module

class src.schemas.contacts.ContactBase(*, first_name: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=50)], last_name: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=50)], email: EmailStr, phone: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=50)], birthday: date, additional_data: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=255)] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Base Pydantic model for contact data.

This class defines the fundamental fields for a contact and is used for data validation and serialization.

additional_data: str | None

Optional additional information about the contact.

birthday: date

The birthday of the contact.

email: EmailStr

The email address of the contact.

first_name: str

The first name of the contact.

last_name: str

The last name of the contact.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

phone: str

The phone number of the contact.

class src.schemas.contacts.ContactCreate(*, first_name: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=50)], last_name: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=50)], email: EmailStr, phone: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=50)], birthday: date, additional_data: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=255)] = None)[source]

Bases: ContactBase

Pydantic model for creating a new contact.

It inherits all fields from ContactBase.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class src.schemas.contacts.ContactResponse(*, first_name: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=50)], last_name: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=50)], email: EmailStr, phone: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=50)], birthday: date, additional_data: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=255)] = None, id: int)[source]

Bases: ContactBase

Pydantic model for the API response.

Includes the contact’s ID from the database and inherits all fields from ContactBase. The from_attributes=True setting is essential for mapping the SQLAlchemy model fields to the Pydantic model.

id: int

The unique ID of the contact.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'from_attributes': True}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class src.schemas.contacts.ContactUpdate(*, first_name: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=50)] = None, last_name: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=50)] = None, email: EmailStr | None, phone: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=50)] = None, birthday: date | None, additional_data: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=255)] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Pydantic model for updating an existing contact.

All fields are optional to allow for partial updates (PATCH requests).

additional_data: str | None

New optional additional information about the contact.

birthday: date | None

The new birthday of the contact.

email: EmailStr | None

The new email address of the contact.

first_name: str | None

The new first name of the contact.

last_name: str | None

The new last name of the contact.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

phone: str | None

The new phone number of the contact.

User role, default is ‘user’.

class src.schemas.users.UserResponse(*, id: int, email: EmailStr, avatar_url: str | None, role: UserRole, is_verified: bool)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Pydantic model for the API response for a user. Excludes sensitive information like the password.

avatar_url: str | None

URL of user’s avatar.

email: EmailStr

User’s email address.

id: int

Unique identifier of the user.

is_verified: bool

Flag indicating if user’s email is verified.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'from_attributes': True}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

role: UserRole

User role.
